thesis.description: Des réovirions défectifs, dont le génome ne possède pas le segment L1, ont été obtenus en coinfectant des cellules L avec les particules defectives et des réovirus thermosensibles de la classes E. Après trois passages à la température permissive, afin-de constituer une population de particules défectives par complémentation avec le mutant ts. le quatrième passage a été effectué à la température non-permissive et les virus ainsi produits ont été exclusivement défectifs. La mutation E a été définie comme étant dans une fonction cis-agissante, la fonction L1 étant une fonction trans-agissante. [...]

Defective reovirions lacking the L1 segment of the viral genome were produced by a process that initia11y 1nvolved the coinfection of L cells by defective cores and the class E ts mutant of reovirus. After three passages et the permissive temperature for the mutant to build up the population of defectives by complementation the fourth passage was carried out at the non-permissive temperature and the progeny virus formed exclusively consisted of defectives. The E mutation has been defined as being in a cis-acting function, the L1 function is a trans-acting function. [...]
thesis.creator: Spandidos, Demetrios A.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Genetics and transcription of reovirus.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Chez des souris non-immunisées, nous avons pu observer l'apparition dans la sang de niveaux significatifs d'activité de L-asparaginase après injection intrapéritonéale d'une solution de L-asparaginase (SA). Nous n'avons cependant noté aucune antivité sanguine de L-asparaginase après injection intrapéritonéale de microcapsules de L-asparaginase (MA). Les taux "aomatiques" de la L-asparaginase ont rapidement diminué après injection de SA, cependant on n'a pas noté la même variation après injection de MA. [...]

In non-immunized mice, significant levels of L-asparaginase activity appeared in the blood after i.p. injection of L-asparaginase solution (AS), whereas no blood L-asparaginase activity appeared after i.p. injection of L-asparaginase microcapsules (AM). "Body" L-asparaginase levels fell very rapidly after injection of AS, but not after AN. AN were no longer physiologically active in-vivo after 8 days post injection, probably because of a decreased permeability of the microcapsules. AN maintained a zero plasma L-asparagine concentration for a significantly longer peroid of time than the equivalent does of AS. AM were more effective than AS in inducing complete regression of established 6C3HED lymphosarcoma in non-immunized mice. [...]
thesis.creator: Chong, Edward D.
thesis.subject: Physiology.
thesis.title: Comparative studies on the effects of L-asparaginase solution and L-asparaginase immobilized within semipermeable microcapsules in non-immunized and immunized mice.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The subject of this thesis is a study of the vocabulary of the non-literary papyri among the published fragments discovered mainly in the spring of 1902 at El-Hîbeh on the Upper Nile. The purpose of this thesis is to make a comparison of the meanings of words with the meanings of the same words when found in the New Testament. These non-literary fragments, like the New Testament, are written in koiné Greek, and like the New Testament, moreover, to a large extent have little or no literary aspirations. [...]
thesis.creator: Smith, Stanley Alfred.
thesis.subject: Manuscripts, Greek (Papyri)
thesis.title: The vocabulary of the non-literary papyri of the Hîbeh.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: As a preliminary to any discussion of the institutional aspects of the Y.M.H.A. of Montreal it is necessary to refer briefly to its history and emergence as a feature of the growth of the Jewish community of the city. This chapter, then, will indicate the more general trends of population and institutional growth of the Jewish community and the relation of the Y.M.H.A. to these. [...]
thesis.creator: Solomon, David N.
thesis.subject: Jews -- Québec (Province) -- Montréal -- Social life and customs.
Young Men’s and Young Women’s Hebrew Associations -- Sociological aspects.
Young Men’s and Young Women’s Hebrew Association (Montréal, Québec)
thesis.title: The Young Men’s Hebrew Association of Montreal : a study of the role of the formal and informal in an ethnic institution.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Division and growth are the basic phenomena of life. Yet, the mechanics of these processes can never be adequately understood if they be regarded as singularly "vital" activities. For, fundamentally, the cell including all its morphological counterparts, is constituted of the same unit as is the inanimate world, namely the molecule. And, because of this common factor in structure, the reactions involved in an activity as cell-division may be interpreted in terms of those properties of molecular behaviour already investigated and known. Thus, solute molecules in a supersaturated solution which orient and attach themselves to a growing crystal, furnish one approach to the study of gene duplication. [...]
thesis.creator: Stern, Herbert.
thesis.subject: Cell division.
Plant cells and tissues.
thesis.title: Micrurgical studies in the physiology of cell division.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The three outstanding causes of death among the acute communicable diseases of childhood (diphtheria, measles and whooping cough) have, in recent years, received a considerable amount of attention by research workers. Advances have been made with respect to prophylaxis and treatment in diphtheria and to a lesser extent in measles. Whooping cough has not shared in this advance commensurate with the urgency of the need. The lack of unanimity of opinion concerning the use of vaccines for active immunity and sera for passive immunity has led to a general apathy in regard to an attempt to conduct a systematic campaign toward the conquest of this disease. The high incidence of whooping cough in infants and pre-school children and the death rate in the former, make this disease one of major importance from the standpoint of public health. [...] pursue this problem by means of laboratory experiment and clinical trial in an attempt to learn enough to make recommendations which, if the interpretation is true, might alter the approach to and treatment of this disease. While the work presented in this thesis reveals a few heretofore unknown facts in regard to Haemophilus pertussis, it is to be regarded only as a foundation for further study. An attempt was made to cover the extensive literature on Haemophilus pertussis and to compile the references in the text in such fashion that their presentation might serve as a ready source of information for those interested in the subject.
thesis.creator: Strean, Lyon P.
thesis.subject: Bacteriology & Immunology.
thesis.title: Active and passive immunization with Haemophilus pertussis.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Le roman historique est, comme l'indique le nom, un genre hybride qui tient à la fois de l'histoire et de la littérature. Non seulement c'est un melange de réalité et de fiction, mais cette réalité ou cette fiction peuvent prendre plusieurs formes -- celle du roman d'aventure, du roman de moeurs, ou du roman d'amour. De toute façon, il y a un cadre historique à maintenir, des moeurs à observer, une couleur locale à donner, et des personnages historiques à représenter. Il n'est pas rare, non plus, de trouver un roman regional ou politique qui, au moment de la composition, n'était pas historique, mais qui l'est devenu par la suite. La littérature canadienne française compte une foule de romans regionaux qui décrivent la vie des défricheurs de terre, et la vie seigneuriale des romans qui peignent des scenes d'une vie qui n'existe plus. [...]
thesis.creator: Taylor, Margaret Bresee.
thesis.subject: French-Canadian fiction -- History and criticism.
thesis.title: Le roman historique canadien français des origines jusqu’à 1914.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Knowledge of Cosmic Rays dates back to the early days of research in radioactivity. As in all fields of research the collection of accurate information about Cosmic Rays has been slow. This has been due, especially in the earlier period, to the lack of apparatus capable of obtaining the necessary data, and as the field of Nuclear Physics was new, no adequate theories had been developed. Within the past two decades, two valuable pieces of apparatus have been developed for the experimental study of Cosmic Rays. These instruments are the coincidence counter circuits employing Geiger-Muller (G.M.) counters and the counter controlled cloud chamber. With these instruments many valuable and accurate data have been obtained. [...]
thesis.creator: Josephson, Vernal.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: The mesotron component in cosmic rays : a study of the absorption of mesotrons and an evaluation of the mesotron lifetime.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The orientation of human erythrocyte membrane proteins was examined using the following techniques: i. lactoperoxidase-catalyzed iodination of the external surface with l25I and the cytoplasmic surface with 131I followed by proteolytic digestion of either the external surface (resealed ghosts) or cytoplasmic surface (inside-out vesicles), ii. phosphorylation of inside-out vesicles with alpha-32P-ATP in conjunction with alkaline phosphatase treatment; and iii. phospholipase C treatment of intact cells followed by enzymic iodination. Protein analysis by SDS polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis revealed several peaks of radioactivity whose orientation was as follows: i. a ~100,000 molecular weight component spanning the membrane asymmetrically; ii. the major glycoprotein (apparent molecular weight 60,000-70,000) accessible at the external surface; iii. ~200.000 molecular weight components accessible to probes at the cytoplasmic surface; iv. a minor glycoprotein (apparent molecular weight 25,000) accessible at both surfaces; and v. minor components of 60,000-70,000, 45,000, and 20,000 molecular weight accessible at the cytoplasmic surface. Phospholipase treatment of intact cells markedly reduced accessibility of proteins to iodination at the external surface, this was partially reversed by pancreatic lipase treatment.

L'orientation des protéines de la membrane, erythrocytaire humaine a été examinée par les techniques suivantes: i. iodination catalysée par la lactoperoxidase de la surface externe avec 125I et de la surface cytoplasmique avec 131I suivie par digestion protéolytique soi de la surface externe (membranes scellées) ou de la surface cytoplasmique (vésicules inversées); ii. phosphorylisation des vésicules inversées avec alpha-32P-ATP en conjonction avec un traitement avec la phosphatase alcaline; iii. traitement des cellules intactes avec phospholipase C suivie par l'iodination enzymatique. Analyse des protéines par l'electrophorèse sur gels de SDS-polyacrylamide a révélé plusieurs pics radioactifs dont l'orientation était comme suit: i. une composante de poids moleculaire de ca. 100,000 traversant la membrane d'une façon asymetrique; ii. la glycoprotéine majeure (poids moleculaire apparent de 60,000-70,000) accessible à la surface externe; iii. une composante de poids moleculaire de ca. 200.000 accessible aux sondes à la surface cytoplasmique, iv. une glycoprotéine mineure (poids moleculaire apparent de 25,000) accessible aux deux surfaces, et v. composantes mineures de poids moleculaire de 60,000-70,000, 45,000, et, 20,000 accessible à la surface cytoplasmique. Digestion des cellules intactes avec la phospholipase C a marquablement réduit l'accesibilité des protéines à l'iodinat1on à la surface externe; ceci a été partiellement renversé par un traitment avec la lipase pancréatique.
thesis.creator: Reichstein, Esther.
thesis.subject: Experimental Medicine.
thesis.title: Arrangement of human erythrocyte membrane proteins.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This project deals with factors in absenteeism in two of the Montreal Protestant Schools during the period beginning with September l, 1945 and ending with February 28, 1946. The schools chosen for this project ware located in crowded industrial sections of the city where housing was substandard and recreational facilities were poor. Nearby water front activities of one area and the proximity of industrial development in the other area were responsible for a crowding of families who were seeking suitable employment. Absenteeism in these two schools has been a problem tor many years, according to the records of the Montreal Protestant Central School Board. New interest in this problem has been stimulated by the Quebec Compulsory Education Act of 1943. The School Boards of Montreal felt that at last they had the support of the provincial government in improving the school attendance and in raising the standard of their schools. They strongly desired to proceed with carefully studied plans to meet the challenge of this new legislation. It was interesting to note that the Montreal Protestant Central School Board reinforced its Attendance Department with trained social workers for the purpose of studying interrelated factors in serious cases of behaviour and absenteeism in their schools. The primary aim of this study is to find out the real reasons for absenteeism. [...]
thesis.creator: Melanson, M. T.
thesis.subject: Social Work.
thesis.title: Factors in absenteeism: A study of twenty-nine absentee pupils in the Montreal Protestant Public Schools, 1945-1946.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The supraoptic nucleus of the hypothalamus and the neural lobe of the hypophysis were examined in 120 g rats made "water deficient" by ingestion of hypertonic (1.75%) sodium chloride solution for 14 days, in comparison with controls given tap water. In the salt-treated group, activation of lupraoptic neurons was indicated by their enlarqement and by depletion of neurosecretory material from most of their terminals in the neural lobe. Following bidaily injection of 3N-thymidine over the 14 days-of treatment, 20.6% astrocytes and 52.9% endothelial cells were labeled in the supraoptic nucleus of treated rats, whereas only 5.9% astrocytes and 17.4% endothelial cells were, in controls. In the neural lobe 45.8% pituicytes and 46.5% endothelial cells were labeled in treated, versus 3.1% pituicytes and 23.9% endothelial cells in controls. Under conditions of "water deficiency", there was not only neuronal activation but also increased proliferation of associated cells, to the extent cf 4 times in supraoptic astrocytes, 14 times in neural lobe pituicytes and 2 to 3 times in endothelial cells.

On a examiné le noyau supra-optique de l'hypothalamus et le lobe neural de l'hypophyse chez des rats de 120g "déshydratés" par l'injection d'une solution hypotonique de chlorure de sodium (1.75%) pendant 14 jours, alors que les témoins ingéreaient de 1'eau du robinet. Chez les animaux traités, on observa un accroissement de taille des neurones supra-optiques et la porte de matériel secrétoire de la plupart de leurs terminations axonales dans le lobe neural, on en conclut que ces neurones avaient été activés par le traitement. [...]
thesis.creator: Paterson, Jean A.
thesis.subject: Anatomy.
thesis.title: Evidence from 3H-thymidine radioautography of increased cell proliferation in the supraoptic nucleus and neural lobe of rats made water-deficient by salt loading.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Antibodirs raised against rat thyroglobulin were labeled with the enzyme horseradish peroxidase, when sections of rat were placed in contact with the labeled antibodies, the staining for peroxidase revealed the sites of binding of the antibodies to the sections. In another series, the antibodies were labeled with radioactive 125I-iodide and tho sites of binding detected by radioautoqraphy. Light and electron microscopic study by either procedure revealed that the luminal colloid was the most active site of bindinq. Within follicular cel1s, the following organelles were labeled: rough endoplasmic reticulum, Golgi apparatus, apical vesicles and colloid droplets. The controls for specificity, sensitivity and methodology demonstrated that the sites of antibody binding were loci of thyroglobin antigenicity. Hence, thyroglobulin or its biological precursors were located in these sites. The use of radioiodine labeled antibodies made it possible to quantify the reactions by silver grain counting in radioautographs. The concentration of thyroglobulin antiqenicity was thus found to increase from rough endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi apparatus, apical vesicles and luminal colloid. Hence the concentration increased along the presumed pathway of thyroglobulin elaboration.

Des anticorps contre la thyroglobuline de rat ont été marqués avec de la peroxydase do raifort et mis en contact avec des coupes de thyroïde de la même espèce: les anticorps liés aux coupes ont été mis en évidence par une réaction histochimique. Dans une autre série, les anticorps ont été marques à l'aide de l'iode radioactif 125I et ceux qui se sont liés aux coupes ont été détectés par la radioautographie. Dans les doux cas, microscopie photontque et électronique ont été utilisées pour localiser les anticorps liés. Une forte réaction s'observe au niveau du colloide thyroïdien. Des réactions apparaissent aussi au niveau des goutelettes de colloïde du cytoplasme, des vésicules apicales, de l'appareil de Golgi et du réticulum endoplasmique. Des tests de spécifité et de sensibilité des méthodes utilisées ont permis de conclure que les réactions sont dues à la présence de la thyroglobuline ou de ses précurseurs. L'étude quantitative des réactions radioautographiques a révélé que la concentration de l'antigénicité thyroglobulinique augmente du réticulum endoplasmique à l'appareil de Golgi, aux vésicules apicales et finalement au colloïde. Il y aurait donc une concentration progressive de la thyroglobuline alors qu'elle migre du réticulum endoplasmique par l'intermédiaire de l'appareil de Golgi et des vésicules apicales jusqu'à la lumière du follicule thyroïdien.
thesis.creator: Paiement, Jacques M.
thesis.subject: Anatomy.
thesis.title: Ultrastructural localization of thyroglobulin in rat thyroids using immunocytochemical and immunoradioautographic methods.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Des anticorps dirigés contre des gammaglobulines humaines (et leur fragments Fab) ont été charactérisés chez les malades porteurs de tumeure solides. Ces anticorps ont été détéctés par la technique d'hémaglutination passive. Des anticorps anti-IgG (Fab) isolés par diverses méthodes appartiennent aux classes IgG, IgA, IgM. Dans la plupart des cas, ces anticorps ont réagi avec des fragments d'IGG obténus après action enzymatique (pépsine et chromotrypaine). Ceux fragments, eux aussi avaient des activités croissés contre des antigènes cytoplasmiques des cellules de mélanome malin.

Anti-immunoglobulin antibodies, previously shown to occur in a number of diseases, have been identified in human solid tumour. These antibodies, including antiFabs (called serum agglutinators), are directed against various reagons of the IgG molecule. They were detected by means of a passive haemagglutination test. The anti- IgG molecules isolated by affinity chromatography and other techniques were found to belong to immunoglobulin classes IgA, IgG and IgM. In the majority of cases the serum agglutinators reacted with autologous and heterologous IgG molecules cleaved by pepsin and chymotrypsin (F(ab')2). The anti-F(ab')2 antibodies reacted with the anti-cytoplasmic tumour-antibodies but not with the anti-membrane antibodies. The leukocyte adherence inhibition (LAI) test was used to demonstrate the interaction between anti-tumour (cytoplasmio) antibody and anti-F(ab')2 antibody. The anti-antibody could represent an "unblocking factor" in this type of method of assessing cell mediated immunity. Finally, in vitro studies to investigate possible production of F(ab')2 fragments by human tumours were performed.
thesis.creator: Hartmann, Dan P.
thesis.subject: Pathology.
thesis.title: The identification and role of anti-immunoglobulins in human malignancy.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Two arginine-specific periplasmic binding proteins have been purified from E. coli ML-30 by affinity chromatography on an arginine-BE-Sepharose 48 gel. By this means it was possible to separate the arginine-binding activity of crude osmotic shock fluid into arginine specific (adsorbed) and arginine non-specific (non-adsorbed) binding frictions. The adsorbed fraction which was displaced with arginine was resolved into two arginine-specific binding proteins by gradient elution with arginine. Both proteins differ on the basis of affinities for arginine, Isoelectric Points, mobilities on anionic polyacryilimide gels, but have identical molecular weights, and similar amino acid composition. One of the binding protein, is similar to the previously purified arginine-specific binding protein of E. coli K12 strain 7. The difference in affinities of these arginine-specific binding proteins suggest that they are part of a biochemical mechanism which facilitates the response of the bacterial cell to varying concentrations of arginine.

Deux protéines périplasmiques de E. ooli ML-30 liant spécifiquement l'arginine ont été purifiées par chromatographie d'affinité sur un gel dt Sepharose-48-arginine-BE. De cette façon il est possible de séparer l'activité de liaison de l'arginine de l'extrait brut obtenu après choc osmotique en deux fractions, l'une spécifique pour l'arginine (adsorbée) et l'autre non-spécifique pour l'arginine (non-adsorbée). La fraction adsorbée, qui peut être déplacée par l'arginine, a été résolue en deux protéines liant spécifiquement l'arginine (B-I et B-II) par un gradient d'élution avec l'arginine. Les deux protéines diffèrent par leur affinité pour l'arginine, leur point isoélectrique, leur mobilité sur des gels anioniques de polyacrylamide, mais ont des poids moleculaires identiques et une composition en acides aminés similaire. Une de ces protéines, est semblable à la proteine de E. coli K12 (strain 7) liant spécifiquement l'arginine qui a été purifiée antérieurement. La différence d'affinité de ces protéines périplasmiques spécifiques pour l'arginine suggèrent qu'elles soient impliquées dans un mécanisme qui facilite la réponse de la cellule bactérienne à différentes concentrations d'arginine.
thesis.creator: Brown, Allan.
thesis.subject: Experimental Medicine.
thesis.title: Purification by bioaffinity chromatography of two arginine-specific periplasmic binding proteins.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Die "Römischen Elegien" Sind in vieler Beziehung ein außerst interessantes Werk; sie bedeuten etwas wesentlich Neues in Goethes Gesamtschaffen und nehmen innerhalb der klassischen - d.h. genauer der klassizistischen - Dichtung eine Sonderstellung ein. Sie sind Ausgangspunkt und zugleich Höhepunkt einer neuen Richtung bei Goethe, der erste große dichterische Niederschlag einer Synthese wesentlich entgegengesetzter Elemente: Nord und Slid, Moderne und Antike,Romantik und Klassik, Wortkunst und Plastik, Natur und Kunst überhaupt. Dies war nur möglich, weil Goethe diese Synthese selbst lebte. [...]
thesis.creator: Block, V. R.
thesis.subject: Goethe, Johann Wolfgang von, 1749-1832 -- Criticism and interpretation.
thesis.title: Goethes römische Elegien.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Z-fraction has been defined operationally as a ligand-binding (bilirubin, sulfobromophthalein) portion of rat hepatic cytosol, that elutes in the molecular weight region of 10^4 daltons after gel filtration (Levi et al., 1969). The fraction has been found to bind hexachlorophene (HCP) and to enhance the oxidation of substrates by the mixed function oxidase system of the isolated microsomal pellet. The binding of HCP in the Z-fraction was low at birth in rats and increased towards adult levels during the first two weeks of life, whereas stimulation of mixed function oxidase activity in adult rat liver microsomes could be achieved with Z-fraction from 1- and 2-day old rats. Polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis as well as binding stoichiometry, confirmed the anticipated heterogeneity of Z-fraction. The inclusion of 20% glycerol in all buffers during isolation prevented aggregation and precipitation and permitted the resolution of the components of Z-fraction by ion-exchange chromatography. [...]

La fraction-Z a été définie de façon opérationnelle comme le portion du cytoplasme hépatique chez le rat qui s'attache des molécules comme la bilirubine ou le sulfobromophthaleine, et qui est aussi caractérisée par son élution dans la région de poids moléculaire 10^4 daltons après filtration sur gel (Levi et al., 1969). Cette fraction s'attache également l'hexachlorophène (HCP) et avantue l'oxidation des substrats par le système oxidatif de fonction mixte du culot microsomal isolé. L'attachement de l'HCP à la fraction-Z est faible à la naissance chez le rat, et augmente vers le niveau adulte durant les deux premières semaines de vie. Cependant, la stimulation de l'activité oxidative des microsomes hépatiques obtenus de rats adultes a pu être observée avec la fraction-Z de rats âgés d'un et deux jours. [...]
thesis.creator: Warner, Margaret.
thesis.subject: Pharmacology and Therapeutics.
thesis.title: Studies on the ligand-binding protein and other components of Z-fraction.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: [...] Within recent years silica gel has received considerable attention because of its use as a sorbent, catalyst and catalyst support. The sorption of about fifty materials on silica has been recorded (2). There is an analogy between gelation of silica sols and many physiological functions; such as, deposition of bone and cartilage, formation of mucus, etc. (3). The reverse of gelation, i.e., the peptization of silica gel, is involved in the disease known as silicosis. Gelation is also involved in the setting of concrete and cements, solidification of many minerals, rubber, plastics and foods (e.g. jellies). The structure of a gel when formed might, by analogy, give an insight into the structure of many of these substances. [...] The study of bound water in silica gels should contribute information on the structure of not only silica but other gels. Little is known about the factors governing bound water in gels in general and less is known about bound water in silica gels in particular. A survey of the literature will show some of the factors governing the gelation process and will give an insight into some of the factors that may affect bound water in silica gels. There are no satisfactory theories of gelation and gel structure because of the lack of adequate knowledge in this field. Theories of silica gel structure will not be discussed here as the information is available elsewhere (1). [...]
thesis.creator: Pearce, Jesse Arthur.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Water in silica gels and sodium silicate in water. : The chlorination of tetrachloroethane. A study of heat evolution during the sorption of gases by charcoal. A new method of studying sorption in a flow system and some experimental values for the sorption of butane. --.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The experimental work described in this thesis concerns three separate problems. The thesis is therefore presented in three sections: section one, "The Diffraction of X-rays by Frozen and by Vitrified Gelatin Gels"; section two, "The storage of Human Blood at Low Temperatures; section three, "The Diffraction of X-rays by Impregnated Charcoal". [...] The original problem was to study the effect of rapid cooling as applied first to gelatin gels and later to the preservation of plant cells by quick freezing methods. The technique and results of this work suggested that similar methods might be applied to the problem of the preservation of whole blood at low temperatures. At that time the problem of the preservation of whole blood was very pressing. However, with the development of methods of preservation of blood serum and the increased use of serum 1n place of whole blood for most war casualty transfusions, the necessity for whole blood decreased. This problem was then discontinued. At this time it was suggested that X-ray diffraction photographs might give some information as to the nature of the metal deposit in impregnated gas mask charcoals. The last section describes experiments designed to determine the chemical and physical state of the metal in metallic impregnated charcoals. [...]
thesis.creator: Matthews, Fred White.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: X-ray diffraction analysis applied to certain war problems. --.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A knowledge of the thickness of overburden is of utmost importance both in ore exploration and in disclosing underground structure. Owing to the cost of drilling and to the fact that geological features upon the earth's surface are not always sufficient, methods for the determination of depth are often sought from other branches of science even if the information so obtained is only qualitative in nature. Giving results not less definite, but having the advantages of simple arrangements and great economy of both time and cost, geophysical methods are now widely used and they have become a powerful and sometimes even indispensable aid to geological interpretation. [...] When the underground structure is simple and known so that the problem can be completely solved theoretically, the experimental determination of depth is a direct one; otherwise, indirect methods must be used in which a certain structure is assumed and the field results are compared with those obtained from a model experiment made to conform to the assumptions. [...] In the following, a review of only two of the geophysical methods, the magne1iic and the electric, are given, since their experimental arrangements are simpler. In the magnetic method, the results obtained on the earth's surface are influenced by all the magnetic properties of the masses surrounding the instrument, whereas in the electric method, the extent of the effective masses may, to a certain degree, be controlled. [...]
thesis.creator: Fu, Ch’eng-Yi.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: The determination of the thickness of overburden by geophysical methods. --.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The present study was undertaken for the purpose of ultimately systematically investigating the possible relationships between hormones, the kidney and hypertension and thus as the basis for later more complete work. This study deals entirely with all the evidence gathered to date which would make the kidney a target organ for hormonal effects, and essentially seeks to review the literature and to give a brief outline of original investigations thus far carried out. [...] Unfortunately accurate quantitative work has not yet been applied to any extent to the study of the effects of hormones on the kidney. We have thus been forced to use indirect criteria which give a rough, and qualitative idea only. [...] The changes in blood N.P.N. may give a qualitative estimate of renal function when it can be established that such alterations are not secondary to metabolic derangements. However even when the elimination of nitrogenous material is expressed as urea clearance certain fundamental objections may be raised, as will appear later. The excretion of water gives us perhaps the best qualitative guide to an upset in renal function particularly when the concentrating ability of the kidney is altered. It is of course understood that such studies are valid only where extrarenal factors can be excluded. Other criteria have been used and will be discussed as they appear. Considerable interest attaches also to in vitro and perfusion experiments where these are available. [...]
thesis.creator: Friedman, Sydney M.
thesis.subject: Anatomy.
thesis.title: The influence of hormones on renal structure and function.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The term "crossing-over" is used to denote the exchange of pieces or segments between homologous chromosomes. The mechanism by which this exchange is brought about has constituted one of the major fields of genetical and cytological research for many years. The early work on crossing over was done by genetical methods which provided the means of analysis of the organization of linkage-groups--an analysis which was fundamental to the chromosome theory of heredity. Among the important discoveries resulting from the study of crossing-over were: (1) the linear arrangement of the genes (Sturtevant, 1913a), (2) the occurrence of interference between the crossing-over of nearby segments (Muller, 1916), and (3) proof that crossing-over occurs in the "4-strand stage" (Bridges, 1916; Bridges and Anderson, 1925; etc.). It was not until 1931, however, that Stern (1931), working with Drosophila, and Creighton and McClintock (1931) and Brink and Cooper (1935), working with Zea mays, demonstrated that crossing-over actually is an interchange of parts between homologous chromosome. [...] The present study was undertaken to determine whether there is also a relationship between the effect on crossing-over in a non-homologous chromosome and the length and position of the inversion by which it is affected. [...]
thesis.creator: Fraser, Frank Clarke.
thesis.subject: Chromosomes.
Crossing over (Genetics).
thesis.title: The effect of X chromosome inversions on crossing-over in the third chromosome of Drosophila melanogaster. --.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: La littérature se devait d'aborder ce thème du conflit des générations, car la pensée humaine doit tenter de tout explorer. L'âme humaine fut et demeurera le champ magnétique des esprits en éveil, une source inépuisable de découvertes et, surtout, le foyer des plus intéressants comme des plus angoissants problèmes. Or, parce que le littérateur se penche sur l'homme, il ne pouvait méconnaître l'existence d'un conflit entre les générations: tôt ou tard, il devait s'arrêter à l'analyse ou à la peinture de ce fait humain. Parce que la littérature est l'image de la vie, elle en traduit l'un de ses aspects: le conflit des générations. Le conflit peut être envisagé comme un complexe de sentiments divers qui opposent deux générations.[...] De part et d'autre, à l'élan correspond un geste de répression, à l'arrogance juvénile un surcroit de sévérité, d'autorité, du moins une affirmation de cette autorité, à l'esprit d'avantgarde, l'esprit conservateur. Les qualités et défauts propres aux générations en regard les divisent: expérience, prétendue sagesse des vieux, inexpérience et grand optimisme des jeunes; chez les adultea, une lassitude de la vie, chez les jeunes, une hâte d'y goûter. Les caractères de la jeunesse contredisent ceux de l'âge mûr. [...]
thesis.creator: Fortier, Mireille.
thesis.subject: FRENCH FICTION -- HISTORY AND CRITICISM.
thesis.title: Le conflict des generations tel que l’illustre le roman français d’apres-guerre. --.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: L'habileté d'abstraction de deux types de "patterns" d'épellation, morphologique et orthographique, a été étudiée au moyen de tests à choix multiple de mots non-significatifs et de mots réels, et au moyen d'un test comprenant la dictée de mots non-significatifs. Ces tests ont été présentés à 160 enfants divisés en deux groupes: un groupe dont l'orthographe était bonne et un groupe dont l'orthographe était pauvre. Chaque groupes se composait de 20 enfants venant de tous les niveaux scolaires compris entre la deuxième et cinquième année. Les deux groupes ont montré clairement une tendance à développer leur habileté d'abstraction des "patterns" morphologiques et orthographiques dans les trois tests. Le groupe dont l'orthographe était bonne, était toujours meilleur que le groupe dont l'orthographe était pauvre. Ce dernier groupe était en retard d'environs deux. ans dans l'acquisition des "patterns" d'épellation. De plus, le groupe dont l'orthographe était bonne avait des meilleurs résultats au niveau des "patterns" orthographiques que morphologiques, alors que le groupe dont l'orthographe était pauvre avait des résultats inverses dans les deux tests utilisant des mots non-significatifs. Ces résultats indiquent que l'abstraction de "patterns" fait partie de l'acquisition de l'épellation.

The ability to abstract two types of spelling patterns, morphological and orthographic, was studied by mean of a multiple choice test of nonsense words, a multiple-choice test of real words and a dictation test of nonsense words. These tests were administered to 160 children, 20 good and 20 poor spellers at each grade level from two to five. Both groups of spellers showed clear developmental trends in their ability to abstract morphological and orthographic patterns on all three tests. The good spellers were consistently better than the poor spellers, who lagged behind the good spellers in the acquisition of spelling patterns by about two years. Good spellers performed better on orthographic patterns than on morphological patterns, while the reverse was true for the poor spellers on the two tests using nonsense words. The findings demonstrate that pattern abstraction is part of the acquisition of spelling.
thesis.creator: Schwartz, Sybil.
thesis.subject: Human Communication Disorders.
thesis.title: A developmental study of children's ability to acquire knowledge of spelling patterns.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The object of this investigation was to obtain certain fundamental information on the question of a possible lignin-carbohydrate union in wood and the nature of same. It has been a matter of speculation for some time as to whether lignin is combined with carbohydrate materials inwood and as to the particular type of carbohydrate involved in the linkage and the nature of the latter, assuming its existence. A review is given in the historical section of previous important work concerning the relationship between lignin and carbohydrate constituents of plant materials; also of present knowledge of the various chemical constituents of woody fibres and of their structure with special reference to the position of these various constituents. Evidence relating to a possible chemical combination of lignin with one or other carbohydrate constituent is discussed. Consideration of the material presented in the historical section leads to the conclusion that the linkage, if any, between lignin and carbohydrate material in woody fibres must be of a relatively weak character. The evidence submitted would seem to indicate the polyuronide hemicelluloses rather than cellulose as the carbohydrate material most probably involved in combination with lignin. [...]
thesis.creator: Fisher, John Henry.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: The synthesis and properties of glycosides related to lignin plant constituents. --.

thesis.description: (1) The chemical structure of Dextran II, the bacterial polysaccharide produced from sucrose by Leuconostoc mesenteroides, has been investigated by means of methylation studies, using improved methylation and fractional distillation techniques. (2) Highly-purified Dextran II has been shown to function as a haptene in precipitin reactions with anti-Leuconostoc sera. (3) The Haworth methylation technique has been modified and adapted generally to the synthesis of partially-methylated glucose derivatives. (4) 2,3-Dimethyl-ß-methyl glucoside and 2,3,4-trimethylglucose have been synthesized by new procedures developed by the author. Improvements have been made in the methods of synthesis of 2,3-dimethyl-, 2,3,4-trimethyl- and 2,3,4,6-tetramethyl methyl glucosides. [...]
thesis.creator: Evans, Taylor Herbert.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: The chemical structure and antigenicity of Dextran II. --.
